topic.name: Feats
topic.para: This material is Open Game Content, and is licensed for public use under the terms of the Open Game License v1.0a.

topic.name: Epic Feats
topic.para: Epic Feats

topic.name: Acquiring Epic Feats
topic.para: Acquiring Epic Feats
Characters gain epic feats in the following ways:
At 21st level, and every three levels thereafter, the character may select an epic feat in place of a nonepic feat.
Each character class gains bonus epic feats according to the class description. These feats must be selected from the list of bonus epic feats for that class.

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites

Most epic feats have prerequisites. A character must have the listed ability score, feat, skill, class feature, or base attack modifier in order to select or use that feat. A character can gain an epic feat at the same level at which he or she gains the prerequisite, just as with regular feats. A prerequisite expressed as a numerical value is a minimum; any value higher than the one given also meets the prerequisite. A character can't use an epic feat if he or she has lost a prerequisite.

topic.name: Types of Epic Feats
topic.para: Types of Epic Feats

Most epic feats are general, meaning that no special rules govern them as a group. Others may be item creation feats or metamagic feats, which follow all the normal rules for such feats, except as specified in the feat's description. In addition, some feats are defined as divine feats or as wild feats. Such feats are described below.

topic.name: Divine Feats
topic.para: Divine Feats

The feats in this category share a few characteristics. First, they all have as a prerequisite the ability to turn (or, in most cases, rebuke) undead. Thus, they are open to clerics, paladins of 4th level or higher, and any prestige class that has that ability. (An ability to turn other creatures does not qualify a character to select one of these feats.) Second, the force that powers a divine feat is the ability to channel positive or negative energy to turn or rebuke undead. Each use of a divine feat costs the character one turn/rebuke attempt from his or her number of attempts each day. If a character doesn't have any turn/rebuke attempts left, he or she can't use the feat. Since turning or rebuking is a standard action, activating any of these feats is also a standard action.

topic.name: Wild Feats
topic.para: Wild Feats

The feats in this category share the characteristic of relating to the ability to use wild shape as a druid. These feats require the character to have the ability to use wild shape before acquiring the feat.

topic.name: Epic Psionic Feats
topic.para: Epic Psionic Feats

Psionic characters can acquire epic 'psionically flavored' feats. Some feats require so much translation that converted feats are provided. Whenever a feat concerns conferring or altering a spell in some fashion, some translation must be done to use it with psionics. Sometimes this translation is as straightforward as changing a few names. Translating epic metamagic feats to epic metapsionic feats requires that Spellcraft prerequisites be replaced with Psicraft. It also requires a little math-instead of casting a spell at a higher level, a psionic character pays more power points. For every spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level the metamagic feat requires, the metapsionic feat requires a character to pay a power point cost equal to its standard cost +2. Likewise, when a feat allows a spellcaster to 'pay' one less level to use a metamagic feat, the psionic version allows a character to pay 2 power points less for a given metapsionic feat.

topic.name: Feats
topic.para: Feats

topic.name: Additional Magic Item Space
topic.para: Additional Magic Item Space [Epic]

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Choose one type of magic item that has a limit on the number a character can simultaneously wear and gain its benefit. The character can now wear one more magic item of this type and also gain its benefit.

topic.name: Normal
topic.para: Normal: Without this feat, a character is limited to one headband, hat, or helmet; one pair of eye lenses or goggles; one cloak, cape, or mantle; one amulet, brooch, medallion, necklace, periapt, or scarab; one suit of armor; one robe; one vest, vestment, or shirt; one pair of bracers or bracelets; one pair of gloves or gauntlets; two rings; one belt; and one pair of boots.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Each time the character takes the feat, it applies to a new type of wearable magic item.

topic.name: Armor Skin
topic.para: Armor Skin [Epic]

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character gains a +1 natural armor bonus to Armor Class, or his or her existing natural armor bonus increases by 1.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

topic.name: Augmented Alchemy
topic.para: Augmented Alchemy [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Int 21, Craft(alchemy) 24 ranks.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Whenever creating an alchemical item or substance, the character can choose to make it more powerful than normal by adding +20 to the DC required to create it and multiplying its price by 5. If the item or substance deals damage, double the damage dealt. If the item or substance doesn't deal damage, double the duration of its effect. If the item or substance doesn't deal damage and doesn't have a specific listed duration (or has an instantaneous duration), double all dimensions of its area. If the item or substance doesn't fit any of these categories, then it cannot be affected by this feat. See the Craft (alchemy) skill description.

topic.name: Automatic Quicken Spell
topic.para: Automatic Quicken Spell [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Quicken Spell, Spellcraft 30 ranks, ability to cast 9th-level arcane or divine spells.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character may cast all 0-, 1st-, 2nd-, and 3rd-level spells as quickened spells without using higher-level spell slots. The normal limit to the number of quickened spells a character may cast per round applies. Spells with a casting time of more than 1 full round can't be quickened.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Each time a character takes the feat, the spells of his or her next three lowest spell levels can now be quickened with no adjustment to their spell slots. This feat doesn't increase the casting time for those spells that normally become full-round actions when cast in metamagic form.

topic.name: Automatic Silent Spell
topic.para: Automatic Silent Spell [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Silent Spell, Spellcraft 24 ranks, ability to cast 9th-level arcane or divine spells.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character may cast all 0-, 1st-, 2nd-, and 3rd-level spells as silent spells without using higher-level spell slots.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Each time a character takes the feat, the spells of his or her next three lowest spell levels can now be silenced with no adjustment to their spell slots. This feat doesn't increase the casting time for those spells that normally become full-round actions when cast in metamagic form. However, since bard spells can't be enhanced with the Silent Spell feat, they can't be affected by this feat either.

topic.name: Automatic Still Spell
topic.para: Automatic Still Spell [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Still Spell, Spellcraft 27 ranks, ability to cast 9th-level arcane or divine spells.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character may cast all 0-, 1st-, 2nd-, and 3rd-level spells as stilled spells without using higher-level spell slots.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Each time a character takes the feat, the spells of his or her next three lowest spell levels can now be stilled with no adjustment to their spell slots. This feat doesn't increase the casting time for those spells that normally become full-round actions when cast in metamagic form.

topic.name: Bane of Enemies
topic.para: Bane of Enemies [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Survival 24 ranks, five or more favored enemies.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Any weapon the character wields against one of his or her favored enemies is treated as a bane weapon for that creature type (thus, its enhancement bonus is increased by +2 and it deals +2d6 points of damage). This ability doesn't stack with similar abilities.

topic.name: Blinding Speed
topic.para: Blinding Speed [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Dex 25.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can act as if hasted for 5 rounds each day. The duration of the effect need not be consecutive rounds. Activating this power is a free action.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Each time he or she takes the feat, it grants an additional 5 rounds of haste per day.

topic.name: Bonus Domain
topic.para: Bonus Domain [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Wis 21, ability to cast 9th-level divine spells.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Choose an additional domain from the character's deity's domain list. The character now has access to that domain's spells as normal for his or her domain spells and the domain's granted powers.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Each time he or she takes the feat, it applies to a different domain.

topic.name: Bulwark of Defense
topic.para: Bulwark of Defense [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Con 25, defensive stance 3/day.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character's defensive stance bonuses increase to +4 Strength, +6 Constitution, +4 resistance bonus on all saves, and +6 dodge bonus to AC.

topic.name: Chaotic Rage
topic.para: Chaotic Rage [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Rage 5/day, chaotic alignment.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Any weapon the character wields while in a rage is treated as an anarchic weapon (it is chaos-aligned and deals an extra 2d6 points of damage against creatures of lawful alignment). This ability does not stack with similar abilities.

topic.name: Colossal Wild Shape
topic.para: Colossal Wild Shape [Wild] [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: The ability to wild shape into a Gargantuan creature.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can use his or her wild shape to take the shape of a Colossal animal.

topic.name: Normal
topic.para: Normal: Without this feat, a character cannot wild shape into an animal of greater than Huge size.

topic.name: Combat Archery
topic.para: Combat Archery [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Dodge, Mobility, Point Blank Shot.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character does not incur any attacks of opportunity for firing a bow when threatened.

topic.name: Normal
topic.para: Normal: Without this feat, a character incurs an attack of opportunity from all opponents who threaten him or her whenever he or she uses a bow.

topic.name: Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor
topic.origname: Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor [Item Creation] [Epic]
topic.refname: Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor

para.refname: Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor

topic.para: Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor [Item Creation] [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Knowledge (arcana) 28 ranks, Spellcraft 28 ranks.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can craft magic arms and armor which exceed the normal limits for such items

topic.name: Craft Epic Rod
topic.para: Craft Epic Rod [Item Creation] [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Craft Rod, Knowledge (arcana) 32 ranks, Spellcraft 32 ranks.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can craft rods that exceed the normal limits for such items.

topic.name: Craft Epic Staff
topic.para: Craft Epic Staff [Item Creation] [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Craft Staff, Knowledge (arcana) 35 ranks, Spellcraft 35 ranks.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can craft staffs that exceed the normal limits for such items.

topic.name: Craft Epic Wondrous Item
topic.para: Craft Epic Wondrous Item [Item Creation] [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Craft Wondrous Item, Knowledge (arcana) 26 ranks, Spellcraft 26 ranks.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can craft wondrous items that exceed the normal limits for such items.

topic.name: Damage Reduction
topic.para: Damage Reduction [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Con 21.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character gains damage reduction 3/-. This does not stack with damage reduction granted by magic items or nonpermanent magical effects, but it does stack with any damage reduction granted by permanent magical effects, class features, or this feat itself.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Each time he or she gains the feat, his or her damage reduction increases by 3.

topic.name: Deafening Song
topic.para: Deafening Song [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Perform 24 ranks, bardic music class feature.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can use song or poetics to temporarily deafen all enemies within a 30-foot spread from him or her. A successful Fortitude save (DC 10 + 1/2 the character's class level + the character's Charisma modifier) negates the effect. The deafening effect lasts for as long as the character continues the deafening song. The character can choose to exclude any characters from this effect. The character may sing, play, or recite a deafening song while taking other mundane actions, but not magical ones (see the bard's inspire courage ability for more details). The character may keep up the deafening song for a maximum of 10 rounds. Using the deafening song counts as one of the character's uses of song or poetics for the day.

topic.name: Death of Enemies
topic.para: Death of Enemies [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Bane of Enemies, Survival 30 ranks, five or more favored enemies.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Any time the character scores a critical hit against one of his or her favored enemies, it must make a Fortitude save (DC 10 + 1/2 character's ranger class level + character's Wisdom modifier) or die instantly.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: Creatures immune to critical hits can't be affected by this feat.

topic.name: Devastating Critical
topic.para: Devastating Critical [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Str 25, Cleave, Great Cleave, Improved Critical (chosen weapon), Overwhelming Critical (chosen weapon), Power Attack, Weapon Focus (chosen weapon).

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Whenever the character scores a critical hit with the chosen weapon, the target must make a Fortitude save (DC 10 + 1/2 character level + character's Strength modifier) or die instantly. (Creatures immune to critical hits can't be affected by this feat.)

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time a character takes the feat, it applies to a different type of weapon.

topic.name: Dexterous Fortitude
topic.para: Dexterous Fortitude [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Dex 25, slippery mind class feature.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Once per round, when targeted by an effect that requires a Fortitude saving throw, the character may make a Reflex save instead to avoid the effect (evasion is not applicable).

topic.name: Dexterous Will
topic.para: Dexterous Will [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Dex 25, slippery mind class feature.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Once per round, when targeted by an effect that requires a Will saving throw, the character may make a Reflex save instead to avoid the effect (evasion is not applicable).

topic.name: Diminutive Wild Shape
topic.para: Diminutive Wild Shape [Wild] [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Ability to wild shape into a Huge animal.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can use wild shape to take the shape of a Diminutive animal.

topic.name: Normal
topic.para: Normal: Without this feat, a character cannot wild shape into an animal of smaller than Tiny size.

topic.name: Dire Charge
topic.para: Dire Charge [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Improved Initiative.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: If the character charges a foe during the first round of combat (or the surprise round, if the character is allowed to act in it), he or she can make a full attack against the opponent charged.

topic.name: Normal
topic.para: Normal: Without this feat, a character may only make a single attack as part of a charge.

topic.name: Distant Shot
topic.para: Distant Shot [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Dex 25, Far Shot, Point Blank Shot, Spot 20 ranks.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character may throw or fire a ranged weapon at any target within line of sight, with no penalty for range.

topic.name: Dragon Wild Shape
topic.para: Dragon Wild Shape [Wild] [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Wis 30, Knowledge (nature) 30 ranks, wild shape 6/day.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character may use wild shape to change into a dragon (black, blue, green, red, white, brass, bronze, copper, gold, or silver). The size limitation is the same as the character's limitation on animal size. The character gains all extraordinary and supernatural abilities of the dragon whose form he or she takes.

topic.name: Efficient Item Creation
topic.para: Efficient Item Creation [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Item creation feat to be selected, Knowledge (arcana) 24 ranks, Spellcraft 24 ranks.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Select an item creation feat. Creating a magic item using that feat requires one day per 10,000 gp of the item's market price, with a minimum of one day.

topic.name: Normal
topic.para: Normal: Without this feat, creating a magic item requires one day for each 1,000 gp of the item's market price.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time a character takes the feat, it applies to a different item creation feat.

topic.name: Energy Resistance
topic.para: Energy Resistance [Epic]

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Choose a type of energy (acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic). The character gains resistance 10 to that type of energy, or the character's existing resistance to that type of energy increases by 10. This feat does not stack with energy resistance granted by magic items or nonpermanent magical effects.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. If the same type of energy is chosen, the effects stack.

topic.name: Enhance Spell
topic.para: Enhance Spell [Metamagic] [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Maximize Spell.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The damage cap for the character's spells increases by 10 dice (for spells that deal a number of dice of damage equal to caster level) or by 5 dice (for spells that deal a number of dice of damage equal to half caster level). An enhanced spell uses up a spell slot four levels higher than the spell's actual level. This feat has no effect on spells that don't specifically deal a number of dice of damage equal to the caster's level or half level, even if the spell's effect is largely dictated by the caster's level.

topic.name: Normal
topic.para: Normal: Without this feat, use the damage dice caps indicated in the spell's description.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character may gain this feat multiple times. Each time he or she selects this feat, the damage cap increases by 10 dice or 5 dice, as appropriate to the spell, and the enhanced spell takes up a spell slot an additional four levels higher.

topic.name: Epic Dodge
topic.para: Epic Dodge [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Dex 25, Dodge, Tumble 30 ranks, improved evasion, defensive roll class feature.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Once per round, when struck by an attack from an opponent the character has designated as the object of his or her dodge, the character may automatically avoid all damage from the attack.

topic.name: Epic Endurance
topic.para: Epic Endurance [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Con 25, Endurance.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Whenever the character makes a check for performing a physical action that extends over a period of time, he or she gets a +10 bonus on the check.

topic.name: Epic Expanded Knowledge
topic.para: Epic Expanded Knowledge [Epic, Psionic]
You learn another power.

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Character level 21st, ability to manifest powers of the normal maximum power level in at least one psionic class.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: You learn one additional power at any level up to the highest level of power you can manifest. You can choose any power, even one that is part of another discipline's list or another class's list.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: You can gain this feat multiple times. Each time, you learn one new power at any level up to the highest level of power you can manifest.

topic.name: Epic Fortitude
topic.para: Epic Fortitude [Epic]

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character gains a +4 bonus on all Fortitude saving throws.

topic.name: Epic Inspiration
topic.para: Epic Inspiration [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Cha 25, Perform 30 ranks, bardic music class feature.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: All competence bonuses, dodge bonuses, and morale bonuses granted by the character's bardic music ability increase by +1. If you have the inspire greatness bardic music ability, it grants one additional bonus HD.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

topic.name: Epic Leadership
topic.para: Epic Leadership [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Cha 25, Leadership, Leadership score 25.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character attracts a cohort and followers as shown below on Table: Epic Leadership. In all other ways Epic Leadership functions as the Leadership feat.

topic.name: Normal
topic.para: Normal: The Leadership feat provides no benefit for leadership scores beyond 25.

topic.name: Leadership Score
topic.para: Leadership Score: A character's Leadership score equals his or her level plus any Charisma modifier. Outside factors can affect a character's Leadership score, as detailed in the Leadership feat.

topic.name: Cohort Level
topic.para: Cohort Level: The character can attract a cohort of up to this level. Regardless of the character's Leadership score, he or she can't recruit a cohort of his or her level or higher.

topic.name: Number of Followers by Level
topic.para: Number of Followers by Level: The character can lead up to the indicated number of characters of each level.
*The maximum cohort level increases by 1 for every 2 points of Leadership above 40. **The number of 1st-level followers increases by 100 for every point of Leadership above 40.

!A character can command one-tenth as many 2nd-level followers as 1st-level followers. A character can command one-half as many 3rd-level followers as 2nd-level followers, one-half as many 4th-level followers as 3rd-level followers, and so on (round fractions up, except any fraction less than 1 rounds to 0). A character can't have a follower of higher than 20th level.
Table: Example Special Epic Cohorts presents some creatures that make good cohorts for epic characters.

topic.name: Epic Prowess
topic.para: Epic Prowess [Epic]

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Gain a +1 bonus on all attacks.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

topic.name: Epic Psionic Focus
topic.para: Epic Psionic Focus [Epic, Psionic]
You can expend your psionic focus to greater effect.

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Character level 21st, ability to manifest powers of the normal maximum power level in at least one psionic class.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: When you expend your psionic focus, you can simultaneously use two feats that require a psionic focus to be expended, instead of just one. The feats must be stackable. You must still spend the requisite power points required to use each metapsionic feat, and you cannot exceed the power point limit set by your manifester level.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: You can take this feat multiple times. Each time you do so, you can simultaneously use one additional feat that requires a psionic focus to be expended.

topic.name: Epic Reflexes
topic.para: Epic Reflexes [Epic]

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character gains a +4 bonus on all Reflex saving throws.

topic.name: Epic Reputation
topic.para: Epic Reputation [Epic]

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character gains a +4 bonus on Bluff, Diplomacy, Gather Information, Intimidate, and Perform checks.

topic.name: Epic Skill Focus
topic.para: Epic Skill Focus [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: 20 ranks in the skill selected.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character gains a +10 bonus on all skill checks with that skill.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time a character takes the feat, it applies to a different skill.

topic.name: Epic Speed
topic.para: Epic Speed [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Dex 21, Run.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character's speed increases by 30 feet. This benefit does not stack with increased speed granted by magic items or nonpermanent magical effects.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: This feat only functions when the character is wearing medium armor, light armor, or no armor.

topic.name: Epic Spell Focus
topic.para: Epic Spell Focus [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Greater Spell Focus and Spell Focus in the school selected, ability to cast at least one 9th-level spell of the school to be chosen.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Add +1 to the Difficulty Class for all saving throws against spells from the school of magic the character selects to focus on. This stacks with the bonuses from Spell Focus and Greater Spell Focus.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time the character takes the feat, it applies to a different school of magic.

topic.name: Epic Spell Penetration
topic.para: Epic Spell Penetration [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Greater Spell Penetration, Spell Penetration.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character gets a +2 bonus on caster level checks to beat a creature's spell resistance. This stacks with the bonuses from Spell Penetration and Greater Spell Penetration.

topic.name: Epic Spellcasting
topic.para: Epic Spellcasting [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Spellcraft 24 ranks, Knowledge (arcana) 24 ranks, ability to cast 9th-level arcane spells. OR Spellcraft 24 ranks, Knowledge (religion) 24 ranks, ability to cast 9th-level divine spells. OR Spellcraft 24 ranks, Knowledge (nature) 24 ranks, ability to cast 9th-level divine spells.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character may develop and cast epic spells. If the character is an arcane spellcaster, he or she may cast a number of epic spells per day equal to his or her ranks in Knowledge (arcana) divided by 10. If the character is a divine spellcaster, he or she may cast a number of epic spells per day equal to his or her ranks in Knowledge (religion) or Knowledge (nature) divided by 10.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: If the character meets more than one set of prerequisites, the limit on the number of spells he or she may cast per day is cumulative.

topic.name: Epic Toughness
topic.para: Epic Toughness [Epic]

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character gains +30 hit points.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

topic.name: Epic Weapon Focus
topic.para: Epic Weapon Focus [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Weapon Focus in the chosen weapon.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Add a +2 bonus to all attack rolls the character makes using the selected weapon.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time the character takes the feat it applies to a different type of weapon.

topic.name: Epic Weapon Specialization
topic.para: Epic Weapon Specialization [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Epic Weapon Focus, Weapon Focus, Weapon Specialization (all in the chosen weapon).

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Add +4 to all damage the character deals using the selected weapon. If the weapon is a ranged weapon, the damage bonus only applies if the target is within 30 feet.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time the character takes the feat, it applies to a different type of weapon.

topic.name: Epic Will
topic.para: Epic Will [Epic]

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character gains a +4 bonus on all Will saving throws.

topic.name: Exceptional Deflection
topic.para: Exceptional Deflection [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Dex 21, Wis 19, Deflect Arrows, Improved Unarmed Strike.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can deflect any ranged attacks (including spells that require ranged touch attacks) as if they were arrows.

topic.name: Extended Life Span
topic.para: Extended Life Span [Epic]

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Add one-half the maximum result of the character's race's maximum age modifier to the character's normal middle age, old, and venerable age categories. Calculate the character's maximum age using the new venerable number. This feat can't lower the character's current age category.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

topic.name: Familiar Spell
topic.para: Familiar Spell [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Int 25 (if the character's spellcasting is controlled by Intelligence) or Cha 25 (if the character's spellcasting is controlled by Charisma).

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Choose one arcane spell the character knows of 8th level or lower. The character's familiar can now use this spell once per day as a spell-like ability, at a caster level equal to the character's caster level. A character cannot bestow a spell to his or her familiar if the spell normally has a material component cost of more than 1 gp or an XP cost.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Each time the character takes the feat, he or she can give his or her familiar a different spell-like ability or another daily use of the same spell-like ability.

topic.name: Fast Healing
topic.para: Fast Healing [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Con 25.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character gains fast healing 3, or the character's existing fast healing increases by 3. This feat does not stack with fast healing granted by magic items or nonpermanent magical effects.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: This feat may be taken multiple times. Its effects stack.

topic.name: Fine Wild Shape
topic.para: Fine Wild Shape [Wild] [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Ability to wild shape into a Diminutive creature.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can use his or her wild shape to take the shape of a Fine animal.

topic.name: Normal
topic.para: Normal: Without this feat, a character cannot wild shape into an animal smaller than Tiny size.

topic.name: Forge Epic Ring
topic.para: Forge Epic Ring [Item Creation] [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Forge Ring, Knowledge (arcana) 35 ranks, Spellcraft 35 ranks.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can forge magic rings that exceed the normal limits for such items.

topic.name: Gargantuan Wild Shape
topic.para: Gargantuan Wild Shape [Wild] [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Ability to wild shape into a Huge animal.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can use your wild shape to take the shape of a Gargantuan animal.

topic.name: Normal
topic.para: Normal: Without this feat, a character cannot wild shape into an animal greater than Huge size.

topic.name: Great Charisma
topic.para: Great Charisma [Epic]

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character's Charisma increases by 1 point.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

topic.name: Great Constitution
topic.para: Great Constitution [Epic]

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character's Constitution increases by 1 point.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

topic.name: Great Dexterity
topic.para: Great Dexterity [Epic]

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character's Dexterity increases by 1 point.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

topic.name: Great Intelligence
topic.para: Great Intelligence [Epic]

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character's Intelligence increases by 1 point.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

topic.name: Great Smiting
topic.para: Great Smiting [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Cha 25, smite ability (from class feature or domain granted power).

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Whenever the character makes a successful smite attack, add twice the appropriate level to damage (rather than just the character's level).

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character may select this feat multiple times. Its effects stack. Remember that two doublings equals a tripling, and so forth.

topic.name: Great Strength
topic.para: Great Strength [Epic]

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character's Strength increases by 1 point.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

topic.name: Great Wisdom
topic.para: Great Wisdom [Epic]

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character's Wisdom increases by 1 point.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

topic.name: Group Inspiration
topic.para: Group Inspiration [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Perform 30 ranks, bardic music class feature.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The number of allies the character can affect with his or her inspire competence or inspire greatness bardic music ability doubles. When inspiring competence in multiple allies, the character can choose different skills to inspire for different allies.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack. Remember that two doublings equals a tripling, and so forth.

topic.name: Hindering Song
topic.para: Hindering Song [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Deafening Song, Perform 27 ranks, bardic music class feature.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can use song or poetics to hinder enemy spellcasters within a 30-foot spread from the character. To successfully cast a spell within this area, a spellcaster must make a Concentration check as if he or she were casting defensively, and all such checks have a penalty equal to half the character's level. The character can choose to exclude any characters from this effect. The character may sing, play, or recite a hindering song while taking other mundane actions, but not magical ones (see the bard's inspire courage ability for more details). The character may keep up the hindering song for a maximum of 10 rounds. Using the hindering song counts as one of the character's uses of song or poetics for the day.

topic.name: Holy Strike
topic.para: Holy Strike [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Smite evil class feature, any good alignment.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Any weapon the character wields is treated as a holy weapon (is good-aligned and deals an extra 2d6 points of damage against creatures of evil alignment). If the weapon already has an alignment, this feat has no effect on the weapon.

topic.name: Ignore Material Components
topic.para: Ignore Material Components [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Eschew Materials, Spellcraft 25 ranks, ability to cast 9th-level arcane or divine spells.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character may cast spells without any material components. This feat does not affect the need for a focus or divine focus.

topic.name: Improved Alignment-Based Casting
topic.para: Improved Alignment-Based Casting [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Access to domain of Chaos, Evil, Good, or Law, alignment must match domain chosen, ability to cast 9th-level divine spells.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Select an alignment-based domain (Chaos, Evil, Good, or Law) to which the character has access. The character casts spells with that alignment descriptor at +3 caster level.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: This benefit overrides (does not stack with) the granted powers of the Chaos, Evil, Good, and Law domains. A character may select this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time a character takes the feat, it applies to a different alignment-based domain to which the character has access.

topic.name: Improved Arrow of Death
topic.para: Improved Arrow of Death [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Dex 19, Wis 19, Point Blank Shot, Precise Shot, arrow of death class feature.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Add +2 to the DC of the character's arrows of death. This feat may be taken multiple times. Its effects stack.

topic.name: Improved Aura of Courage
topic.para: Improved Aura of Courage [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Cha 25, aura of courage class ability.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character's aura of courage grants a +8 morale bonus on saving throws against fear effects.

topic.name: Improved Aura of Despair
topic.para: Improved Aura of Despair [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Cha 25, aura of despair class ability.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character's aura of despair causes a -4 morale penalty on all saving throws.

topic.name: Improved Combat Casting
topic.para: Improved Combat Casting [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Combat Casting, Concentration 25 ranks.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character doesn't incur attacks of opportunity for casting spells when threatened.

topic.name: Improved Combat Reflexes
topic.para: Improved Combat Reflexes [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Dex 21, Combat Reflexes.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: There is no limit to the number of attacks of opportunity the character can make in one round. (the character still can't make more than one attack of opportunity for a given oppertunity.)

topic.name: Improved Darkvision
topic.para: Improved Darkvision [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Darkvision.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The range of the character's darkvision doubles. This feat does not stack with darkvision granted by magic items or nonpermanent magical effects.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: This feat may be taken multiple times. Its effects stack. Remember that two doublings equals a tripling, and so on.

topic.name: Improved Death Attack
topic.para: Improved Death Attack [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Death attack class feature, sneak attack +5d6.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Add +2 to the DC of the character's death attack.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: This feat may be taken multiple times. Its effects stack.

topic.name: Improved Elemental Wild Shape
topic.para: Improved Elemental Wild Shape [Wild] [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Wis 25, ability to wild shape into an elemental.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character's ability to wild shape into an elemental is expanded to include all elemental creatures (not just air, earth, fire, and water elementals) of any size that the character can take when using wild shape to become an animal. The character gains all extraordinary and supernatural abilities of the elemental whose form he or she takes.

topic.name: Normal
topic.para: Normal: Without this feat, a character may only wild shape into a Small, Medium-size, or Large air, earth, fire, or water elemental.

topic.name: Improved Favored Enemy
topic.para: Improved Favored Enemy [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Five or more favored enemies.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Add +1 to the bonus on Bluff, Listen, Sense Motive, Spot, and Survival checks and damage rolls against all the character's favored enemies.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: This feat may be taken multiple times. Its effects stack.

topic.name: Improved Heighten Spell
topic.para: Improved Heighten Spell [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Heighten Spell, Spellcraft 20 ranks.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: As Heighten Spell, but there is no limit to the level to which the character can heighten the spell.

topic.name: Normal
topic.para: Normal: Without this feat, a spell can only be heightened to a maximum of 9th level.

topic.name: Improved Ki Strike
topic.para: Improved Ki Strike [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Wis 21, ki strike (adamantine).

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character's unarmed strikes are treated as epic magic weapons for the purposes of damage reduction.

topic.name: Improved Low-Light Vision
topic.para: Improved Low-Light Vision [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Low-light vision.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The range of the character's low-light vision doubles. This feat does not stack with low-light vision granted by magic items or nonpermanent magical effects.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: This feat may be taken multiple times. Its effects stack. Remember that two doublings equals a tripling, and so on.

topic.name: Improved Manifestation
topic.para: Improved Manifestation [Epic, Psionic]
You increase your power point reserve.

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Character level 21st, ability to manifest powers of the normal maximum power level in at least one psionic class.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: When you select this feat, you gain 19 power points.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: You can gain this feat multiple times. Each time you do so, you gain an additional number of power points equal to your previous benefit +2.

topic.name: Improved Manyshot
topic.para: Improved Manyshot [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Dex 19, base attack bonus +21, Many-shot, Point Blank Shot, Rapid Shot

topic.name: Benefits
topic.para: Benefits: As Manyshot, but the number of arrows the character can fire is limited only by his or her base attack bonus (two arrows, plus one arrow for every 5 points of base attack bonus above +6).

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: Regardless of the number of arrows the character fires, he or she only applies precision-based damage (such as sneak attack damage or the ranger's favored enemy bonus) once. If the character scores a critical hit, only one of the arrows deals critical damage (character's choice); all others deal normal damage.

topic.name: Normal
topic.para: Normal: With the Manyshot feat, the character is limited to a maximum of four arrows fired (when the character's base attack bonus is +16 or higher).

topic.name: Improved Metamagic
topic.para: Improved Metamagic [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Four metamagic feats, Spellcraft 30 ranks.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The spell slot modifier of all the character's metamagic feats is reduced by one level, to a minimum of +1. This feat has no effect on metamagic feats whose spell slot modifier is +1 or less.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. The effects stack, though a character can't reduce any metamagic feat's spell slot modifier to less than +1.

topic.name: Improved Metapsionics
topic.para: Improved Metapsionics [Epic, Psionic]
You can manifest powers using metapsionic feats more easily than normal.

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Character level 21st, four metapsionic feats, Psicraft 30 ranks.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Metapsionic powers you manifest cost 2 power points less than normal (to a minimum of 1 power point).
This feat has no effect on metapsionic powers that inflate the cost by only 2 power points.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: You can gain this feat multiple times. The effects stack, though you can't lower the cost of any metapsionic power to less than 1 power point.

topic.name: Improved Sneak Attack
topic.para: Improved Sneak Attack [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Sneak attack +8d6.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Add +1d6 to the character's sneak attack damage.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: This feat may be taken multiple times. Its effects stack.

topic.name: Improved Spell Capacity
topic.para: Improved Spell Capacity [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Ability to cast spells of the normal maximum spell level in at least one spellcasting class.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: When the character selects this feat, he or she gains one spell slot per day of any level up to one level higher than the highest-level spell the character can already cast in a particular class. The character must still have the requisite ability score (10 + spell level) in order to cast any spell stored in this slot. If the character has a high enough ability modifier to gain one or more bonus spells for this spell level, he or she also gains the bonus spells for this spell level. The character must use the spell slot as a member of the class in which he or she can already cast spells of the normal maximum spell level.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times.

topic.name: Spell Slots Above 9th Level
topic.para: The Improved Spell Capacity feat allows characters to gain spell slots above 9th level (which can be used to hold lower-level spells or spells whose level has been increased beyond 9th by the use of metamagic feats).

A character with a very high score in the ability associated with his or her spellcasting (Intelligence for wizards; Wisdom for clerics, druids, paladins, and rangers; or Charisma for bards and sorcerers) may receive bonus spells of those levels, as shown on Table: Expanded Ability Modifiers and Bonus Spells, but only if they already have at least one spell slot of that level (such as from the Improved Spell Capacity feat). A character without any spell slots of a level can't receive any bonus spells of that level, even if the appropriate ability score is high enough to award them.

Even though the table only includes ability scores up to 61 and spell slots up to 25th level, the progression continues infinitely in both directions. For ability scores beyond 61, or for spell slots above 25th level, expand the table to follow the same patterns as shown.

para.b: Table: Expanded Ability Modifiers and Bonus Spells

topic.name: Improved Spell Resistance
topic.para: Improved Spell Resistance [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Must have spell resistance from a feat, class feature, or other permanent effect.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character's spell resistance increases by +2.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

topic.name: Improved Stunning Fist
topic.para: Improved Stunning Fist [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Dex 19, Wis 19, Improved Unarmed Strike, Stunning Fist.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Add +2 to the DC of the character's stunning attack.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: This feat may be taken multiple times. Its effects stack.

topic.name: Improved Whirlwind Attack
topic.para: Improved Whirlwind Attack [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Int 13, Dex 23, Combat Expertise, Dodge, Mobility, Spring Attack, Whirlwind Attack.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: As a standard action, the character can make one melee attack for every five points of his or her base attack bonus (including epic attack bonus, round fractions down).
The character cannot attack any one opponent more than once as part of this action. These attacks (as well as all other attacks made until the start of the character's next turn) suffer a -4 penalty.
When using the Improved Whirlwind feat, the character also forfeits any bonus or extra attacks granted by other spells or abilities (such as Cleave or the haste spell).
Since these attacks are made as part of a standard action the character can't make a 5-foot step between any two of the attacks.

topic.name: Normal
topic.para: Normal: Without this feat, using the Whirlwind Attack feat requires a full attack action, and the character can take a 5-foot step between any two of the attacks.

topic.name: Incite Rage
topic.para: Incite Rage [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Cha 25, greater rage class feature.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: When the character enters a rage, he or she can incite a barbarian rage in any or all allies within 60 feet. (Any ally who doesn't wish to become enraged is unaffected.) The ally gains +4 to Strength, +4 to Constitution, and a +2 morale bonus on Will saves, but takes a -2 penalty to AC, for as long as the character remains raging. The rage of affected allies lasts a number of rounds equal to 3 + their Constitution modifier, regardless of whether they remain within 60 feet of the character. This is otherwise identical with normal barbarian rage (including the fatigue at its end).

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: This is a mind-affecting effect.

topic.name: Infinite Deflection
topic.para: Infinite Deflection [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Dex 25, Combat Reflexes, Deflect Arrows, Improved Unarmed Strike.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character may perform any number of deflections each round, as the Deflect Arrows feat.

topic.name: Inspire Excellence
topic.para: Inspire Excellence [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Perform 30 ranks, bardic music class feature.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can use song or poetics to grant a bonus to one ability score to his or her allies. To be affected, an ally must hear the bard sing for 1 full round. The effect lasts as long as the bard sings and for 5 rounds after the bard stops singing (or 5 rounds after the ally can no longer hear the bard). While singing, the bard can fight but cannot cast spells, activate magic items by spell completion (such as scrolls), or activate magic items by command word (such as wands). Each ally to be inspired gains a +4 competence bonus to the same ability score, which the character must choose before he or she begins inspiring. Inspire excellence is a supernatural, mind-affecting ability. Use of this feat counts as one of the character's bardic music uses for the day.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: This feat is treated as a bardic music inspiration ability for purposes of feats that affect such abilities.

topic.name: Instant Reload
topic.para: Instant Reload [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Quick Draw, Rapid Reload, Weapon Focus (crossbow type to be selected).

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character may fire the selected type of crossbow at his or her full normal attack rate. Reloading the crossbow does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time a character takes the feat, it applies to a different type of crossbow.

topic.name: Intensify Spell
topic.para: Intensify Spell [Metamagic] [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Empower Spell, Maximize Spell, Spellcraft 30 ranks, ability to cast 9th-level arcane or divine spells.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: All variable, numeric effects of an intensified spell are maximized, then doubled. An intensified spell deals twice maximum damage, cures twice the maximum number of hit points, affects twice the maximum number of targets, and so forth, as appropriate. Saving throws and opposed rolls are not affected. An intensified spell uses up a spell slot seven levels higher than the spell's actual level. A character can't combine the effects of this feat with any other feat that affects the variable, numeric effects of a spell.

topic.name: Keen Strike
topic.para: Keen Strike [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Str 23, Wis 23, Improved Critical (unarmed strike), Improved Unarmed Strike, Stunning fist, ki strike (adamantine).

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character's unarmed strike has a critical threat range of 18-20 and deals slashing damage (at the character's option any attack can deal bludgeoning damage, but cannot then take advantage of the enhanced threat range). This ability doesn't stack with other abilities that expand that character's unarmed strike's threat range.

topic.name: Lasting Inspiration
topic.para: Lasting Inspiration [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Perform 25 ranks, bardic music class feature.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The effects of the character's bardic music inspiration abilities last for ten times as long as normal after he or she stops singing. This feat has no effect on inspiration abilities that have no duration after the character stops singing.

topic.name: Legendary Climber
topic.para: Legendary Climber [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Dex 21, Balance 12 ranks, Climb 24 ranks.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can ignore any check penalties applied for accelerated climbing or rapid climbing.

topic.name: Normal
topic.para: Normal: Without this feat, a character takes a -5 penalty on Climb checks when attempting to cover his or her full speed in climbing distance in a round, or a -20 penalty when attempting to cover twice his or her speed in climbing distance in a round.

topic.name: Legendary Commander
topic.para: Legendary Commander [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Cha 25, Epic Leadership, Leadership, Diplomacy 30 ranks, must rule own kingdom and have a stronghold.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Multiply the number of followers of each level that the character can lead by 10. This has no effect on cohorts.

topic.name: Legendary Leaper
topic.para: Legendary Leaper [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Jump 24 ranks.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character need only move 5 feet in a straight line to make a running jump.

topic.name: Normal
topic.para: Normal: Without this feat, a character must move at least 20 feet in a straight line before attempting a running jump.

topic.name: Legendary Rider
topic.para: Legendary Rider [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Ride 24 ranks.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character doesn't take a penalty on Ride checks when riding a mount without a saddle (bareback). The character never needs to make a Ride check to control a mount in combat (and even controlling a mount not trained for combat doesn't require an action).

topic.name: Normal
topic.para: Normal: Without this feat, a character takes a -5 penalty on Ride checks without a saddle, and must make a Ride check to control a mount in combat (and controlling a mount not trained for combat requires a move action).

topic.name: Legendary Tracker
topic.para: Legendary Tracker [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Wis 25, Track, Knowledge (nature) 30 ranks, Survival 30 ranks.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can track creatures across water, under-water, or through the air. This adds the surfaces of water, underwater, and air to the list of surfaces found under the Track feat:

topic.name: Legendary Wrestler
topic.para: Legendary Wrestler [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Str 21, Dex 21, Improved Unarmed Strike, Escape Artist 15 ranks.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character gains a +10 bonus on all grapple checks.

topic.name: Lingering Damage
topic.para: Lingering Damage [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Sneak attack +8d6, crippling strike class feature.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Any time the character deals damage with a sneak attack, that target takes damage equal to the character's sneak attack bonus damage on the character's next turn as well.

topic.name: Magical Beast Companion
topic.para: Magical Beast Companion [Wild] [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Knowledge (nature) 24 ranks, wild shape 6/day.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The following magical beasts are added to the lists of animal companions from which you can select.

topic.name: 1st Level
topic.para: Stirge
Darkmantle

topic.name: 4th Level
topic.para: Hippogriff
Shocker lizard

topic.name: 7th Level
topic.para: Cockatrice
Ankheg
Griffon
Owlbear
Sea cat*

topic.name: 10th Level
topic.para: Basilisk
Digerster
Girallon
Spider eater

topic.name: 13th Level
topic.para: Bulette
Chimera
Remorhaz

topic.name: 16th Level
topic.para: Gorgon
Gray render

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: Creatures marked with an asterisk are available only in an aquatic environment.

topic.name: Magical Beast Wild Shape
topic.para: Magical Beast Wild Shape [Wild] [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Wis 25, Knowledge (nature) 27 ranks, wild shape 6/day.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can use his or her normal wild shape ability to take the form of a magical beast. The size limitation is the same as the character's limitation on animal size. The character gains all supernatural abilities of the magical beast whose form he or she takes.

topic.name: Master Staff
topic.para: Master Staff [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Craft Staff, Spellcraft 15 ranks.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: When the character activates a staff, he or she can substitute a spell slot instead of using a charge. The spell slot must be one the character ahs not used for the day, though the character may lose a prepared spell to emulate a wand charge (the character may not lose prepared spells from his or her school of specialty, if any). The spell slot lost must be equal to or higher in level than the specific spell stored in the staff, including any level-increasing metamagic enhancements. A character cannot emulate a charge for a staff function that does not match a specific spell.

topic.name: Master Wand
topic.para: Master Wand [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Craft Wand, Spellcraft 15 ranks.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: When the character activates a wand, he or she can substitute a spell slot instead of using a charge. The spell slot must be one the character has not used for the day, though he or she may lose a prepared spell to emulate a wand charge (the character may not lose prepared spells from his or her school of specialty, if any). The spell slot lost must be equal to or higher in level than the spell stored in the wand, including any level-increasing metamagic enhancements.

topic.name: Mighty Rage
topic.para: Mighty Rage [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Str 21, Con 21, greater rage class feature, rage 5/day.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: When the character rages, he or she gains a +8 bonus to Strength and Constitution and a +4 morale bonus on Will saves. (These bonuses replace the normal rage bonuses.)

topic.name: Mobile Defense
topic.para: Mobile Defense [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Dex 15, Dodge, Mobility, Spring Attack, defensive stance 3/day class feature.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: While in a defensive stance, the character may take one 5-foot adjustment each round without losing the benefits of the stance.

topic.name: Normal
topic.para: Normal: Without this feat, a character can't move while in a defensive stance.

topic.name: Multispell
topic.para: Multispell [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Quicken Spell, ability to cast 9th-level arcane or divine spells.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character may cast one additional quickened spell in a round.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

topic.name: Multiweapon Rend
topic.para: Multiweapon Rend [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Dex 15, base attack bonus +9, three or more hands, Multiweapon Fighting.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: If the character hits an opponent with two or more weapons (wielded in different hands) in the same round, he or she may automatically rend the opponent. This rending deals additional damage equal to the base damage of the smallest weapon that hit plus 1 1/2 times the character's Strength modifier. The character can only rend once per round, regardless of how many successful attacks he or she makes.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: This feat replaces the Two-Weapon Rend feat for creatures with more than two arms.

topic.name: Music of the Gods
topic.para: Music of the Gods [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Cha 25, Perform 30 ranks, bardic music class feature.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character's bardic music can affect even those normally immune to mind-affecting effects. However, such creatures gain a +10 bonus on their Will saves to resist such effects.

topic.name: Negative Energy Burst
topic.para: Negative Energy Burst [Divine] [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Cha 25, ability to rebuke or command undead, ability to cast inflict critical wounds, any evil alignment.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can use one rebuke or command undead attempt to unleash a wave of negative energy in a 60-foot-burst. Roll a normal rebuke (or command) check, except that the negative energy burst affects living creatures rather than undead. Any creature that would be rebuked by this result gains one negative level. Any creature that would be commanded by this check gains two negative levels. The Fortitude save DC to remove these levels one day later is equal to 10 + 1/2 the character's effective turning level + the character's Charisma modifier.

topic.name: Overwhelming Critical
topic.para: Overwhelming Critical [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Str 23, Cleave, Great Cleave, Improved Critical (chosen weapon), Power Attack, Weapon Focus (chosen weapon).

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: When using the weapon the character has selected, he or she deals an extra 1d6 points of bonus damage on a successful critical hit. If the weapon's critical multiplier is x3, add +2d6 points of bonus damage instead, and if the multiplier is x4, add +3d6 points of bonus damage instead. Creatures immune to critical hits can't be affected by this feat.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time a character takes the feat, it applies to a different type of weapon.

topic.name: Penetrate Damage Reduction
topic.para: Penetrate Damage Reduction [Epic]
Select a special material, such as adamantine.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character melee weapons (including natural weapons) are treated as being crafted from the chosen special material for the purposes of bypassing the damage reduction of any creature the character strikes. None of the other special properties of special materials are gained by the character's melee weapons.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Each time the feat is selected the character selects a different special material. The character's melee attacks are treated as being crafted of all chosen materials for the purposes of bypassing damage reduction.

topic.name: Perfect Health
topic.para: Perfect Health [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Con 25, Great Fortitude.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character is immune to all nonmagical diseases, as well as to all poisons whose Fortitude save DC is 25 or less.

topic.name: Perfect Multiweapon Fighting
topic.para: Perfect Multiweapon Fighting [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Dex 25, three or more hands, Greater Multiweapon Fighting, Multiweapon Fighting.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can make as many attacks with each extra weapon as with his or her primary weapon, using the same base attack bonus. The character still takes the normal penalties for fighting with two weapons.

topic.name: Normal
topic.para: Normal: A creature without this feat can make only one attack per round with each extra weapon (or two attacks per round with each weapon if it has Multiweapon Fighting, or three attacks per round with each extra weapon if it has Greater Multiweapon Fighting). Each attack after the first extra attack has a cumulative -5 penalty.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: This feat replaces the Perfect Two-Weapon Fighting feat for creatures with more than two arms.

topic.name: Perfect Two-Weapon Fighting
topic.para: Perfect Two-Weapon Fighting [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Dex 25, Greater Two-Weapon Fighting, Improved Two-Weapon Fighting, Two-Weapon Fighting.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can make as many attacks with his or her off-hand weapon as with his or her primary weapon, using the same base attack bonus. The character still takes the normal penalties for fighting with two weapons.

topic.name: Normal
topic.para: Normal: Without this feat, a character can only get a single attack with an off-hand weapon (or two attacks with an off-hand weapon if he or she has Improved Two-Weapon Fighting, or three attacks with an off-hand weapon if he or she has Greater Two-Weapon Fighting).

topic.name: Permanent Emanation
topic.para: Permanent Emanation [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Spellcraft 25 ranks, ability to cast the spell to be made permanent.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Designate any one of the character's spells whose area is an emanation from the character. This spell's effect is permanent (though the character can dismiss or restart it as a free action). Effects that would normally dispel this spell instead suppress it for 2d4 rounds.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: This feat may be taken multiple times. Each time, select a different spell to become permanent.

topic.name: Planar Turning
topic.para: Planar Turning [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Wis 25, Cha 25, ability to turn or rebuke undead.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can turn or rebuke outsiders as if they were undead. An outsider has effective turn resistance equal to half its spell resistance (round down). If the character can turn undead, he or she turns (or destroys) all evil outsiders and rebukes (or commands) all nonevil outsiders. If the character can rebuke undead, he or she rebukes (or commands) all evil outsiders and turns (or destroys) all nonevil outsiders.

topic.name: Plant Wild Shape
topic.para: Plant Wild Shape [Wild] [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Knowledge (nature) 24 ranks, wild shape 4/day.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can use his or her normal wild shape ability to take the form of a plant. The size limitation is the same as the character's limitation on animal size.

topic.name: Polyglot
topic.para: Polyglot [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Int 25, Speak Language (five languages).

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can speak all languages. If the character is literate, he or she can also read and write all languages (not including magical script).

topic.name: Positive Energy Aura
topic.para: Positive Energy Aura [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Cha 25, ability to turn undead, ability to cast dispel evil.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Every undead creature that comes within 15 feet of the character is automatically affected as if the character had turned it. This doesn't cost a turning attempt, and the character doesn't have to roll turning damage (it automatically affects all undead in a 15-foot burst), but it only turns undead with Hit Dice equal to or less than the character's effective cleric level minus 10 (and automatically destroys undead with Hit Dice equal to or less than the character's effective cleric level minus 20). Just as with normal turning, the character can't affect undead that have total cover relative to him or her.

topic.name: Power Knowledge
topic.para: Power Knowledge [Epic, Psionic]
You add two additional powers to your list of powers known.

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Character level 21st, ability to manifest powers of the normal maximum power level in at least one psionic class.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: You learn two new powers of any level up to the highest level of power you can manifest. The powers you select must be on your class list or the list for your discipline.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: You can gain this feat multiple times. Each time, you learn two new powers at any level up to the highest level of power you can manifest.

topic.name: Psicrystal Power
topic.para: Psicrystal Power [Epic, Psionic]
Your psicrystal can manifest a power.

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Character level 21st, Intelligence 25 or Charisma 25 (depending on which is your key ability score for manifesting).

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Choose one power you know of 8th level or lower. Your psicrystal can now manifest this power once per day at your manifester level (the psicrystal gains sufficient power points to manifest the power once). You cannot bestow a power upon your psicrystal if the power normally has any experience point cost.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: You can gain this feat multiple times. Each time you take the feat, you can give your psicrystal knowledge of a new power (and it gains sufficient power points to manifest that power once).
All power points gained by a psicrystal from multiple applications of this feat go into its reserve and can be used to manifest the powers it knows as you desire.

topic.name: Ranged Inspiration
topic.para: Ranged Inspiration [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Bardic music class feature, Perform 25 ranks

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Double the range of any bardic music ability that has a range. (If the creature must hear the bard to be affected by the ability, that requirement doesn't change regardless of any extended range the bard's ability may have.)

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack. Remember that two doublings equals a tripling, and so forth.

topic.name: Rapid Inspiration
topic.para: Rapid Inspiration [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Perform 25 ranks, bardic music class feature.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can use any of his or her bardic music inspiration abilities as a standard action. The inspiration takes effect immediately after the character concludes the action.

topic.name: Reactive Countersong
topic.para: Reactive Countersong [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Combat Reflexes, Perform 30 ranks, bardic music class feature.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can begin a countersong at any time, even when it isn't his or her turn (much like a wizard who has readied a counterspell action), though the character doesn't have to ready an action to do so. The character can't use Reactive Countersong at the same time he or she isusing another bardic music ability (though the character could stop the other bardic music ability to begin Reactive Countersong if so desired).

topic.name: Normal
topic.para: Normal: Without this feat, a character can only use counter-song on his or her turn.

topic.name: Reflect Arrows
topic.para: Reflect Arrows [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Dex 25, Deflect Arrows, Improved Unarmed Strike.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: When the character deflects an arrow or other ranged attack, the attack is reflected back upon the attacker at the character's base ranged attack bonus.

topic.name: Righteous Strike
topic.para: Righteous Strike [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Wis 19, Improved Unarmed Strike, Stunning Fist, any lawful alignment.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character's unarmed strike is treated as an axiomatic weapon (it is lawfully aligned and deals an extra 2d6 points of damage against creatures of chaotic alignment). This ability doesn't stack with similar abilities.

topic.name: Ruinous Rage
topic.para: Ruinous Rage [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Str 25, Improved Sunder, Power Attack, rage 5/day.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: While in a rage, the character ignores the hardness of any object he or she strikes. Also, double the character's Strength bonus for the purposes of any Strength check made to break an object with sudden force rather than by dealing normal damage (including bursting bindings, such as ropes or manacles).

topic.name: Scribe Epic Scroll
topic.para: Scribe Epic Scroll [Item Creation] [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Scribe Scroll, Knowledge (arcana) 24 ranks, Spellcraft 24 ranks.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character can scribe scrolls that exceed the normal limits for such items. Even this feat does not allow the character to scribe a scroll with an epic spell.

topic.name: Self-Concealment
topic.para: Self-Concealment [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Dex 30, Hide 30 ranks, Tumble 30 ranks, improved evasion.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Attacks against the character have a 10% miss chance, similar to the effect of concealment. The character loses this benefit whenever he or she would lose his or her Dexterity bonus to AC.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: This feat may be taken multiple times. Each time it is taken, the miss chance increases by 10% to a maximum of 50% after it has been taken five times.

topic.name: Shattering Strike
topic.para: Shattering Strike [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Epic Weapon Focus (unarmed strike), Weapon Focus (unarmed strike), Concentration 25 ranks, ki strike (adamantine).

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: When using an unarmed strike to attempt to break an object with sudden force (rather than by dealing normal damage), make a Concentration check rather than a Strength check. The break DC remains the same. Using Shattering Strike is a full-round action that incurs attacks of opportunity. The character can't use Shattering Strike to escape bonds (unless he or she is so bound as to allow the character to make an unarmed strike against his or her bindings).

topic.name: Sneak Attack of Opportunity
topic.para: Sneak Attack of Opportunity [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Sneak attack +8d6, opportunist class feature.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: Any attack of opportunity the character makes is considered a sneak attack.

topic.name: Spectral Strike
topic.para: Spectral Strike [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
topic.para: Prerequisites: Wis 19, ability to turn or rebuke undead.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character's attacks deal damage normally against incorporeal creatures.

topic.name: Normal
topic.para: Normal: Without this feat, even attacks that can damage an incorporeal creature have a 50% chance to deal no damage.

topic.name: Spell Knowledge
topic.para: Spell Knowledge [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisite
topic.para: Prerequisite: Ability to cast spells of the maximum normal spell level of an arcane spellcasting class.

topic.name: Benefit
topic.para: Benefit: The character learns two new arcane spells of any level up to the maximum level he or she can cast. This feat does not grant any additional spell slots.

topic.name: Special
topic.para: Special: A character can gain this feat multiple times.

topic.name: Spell Opportunity
topic.para: Spell Opportunity [Epic]

topic.name: Prerequisites
